info.document:
Bollywood actress Kangana Ranaut requires absolutely no introduction. The actress has been venting out her issues publicly ever since she's got a chance to. From talking about her relationship with Hrithik Roshan to dragging the Pancholi family, Kangana has left no stone unturned.

She's not a man hater but she is fearless. The actress has been in news for dissing Bollywood and has no qualms about 0 support from her colleagues. During Jagran Cinema Summit, she spoke about gender equality and said,

I am not sure when I became a feminist. The whole perception of inequality and of one being inferior to the other is too bizarre for me to come to terms with. I can't understand it. Feminism is just indicative that the balance between genders is missing from the system, and it's a sorry state to be in."

She even gave an instance on how women are expected to not behave in a certain way.

"Certain things are expected of men, but sneered upon when women do it. Consider their sexual lives for instance. Having sex is fun for a man, but for a woman, it's almost criminal. Such is the general perception of the glamour world. Men brag about their Casanova sons, but when it comes to their daughters, she can't be wearing a bikini. [It is okay if] 15 bikini-clad women are hovering around him and his son, but the daughter has to comply with feudal ideas."

Well, looks like she might be taking a dig at Hrithik Roshan once again. But as far as her ideology is concerned, her points are valid and brave.
